I say the answer is C. I originally thought the answer would be D but the question indicated that we have the searches set to scheduled instead of realtime already. "You have six correlation searches scheduled".

Is there a reference to given answer? 
I think the answer is D.

comments.content: I don't think you can change this definition per index, but per search

choices.D: If indexed realtime search is enabled, disable it for the notable index.
choices.A: Change the search heads to do local indexing of summary searches.
choices.C: Increase memory and CPUs on the search head(s) and add additional indexers.
choices.B: Add heavy forwarders between the universal forwarders and indexers so inputs can be parsed before indexing.

questions.question_text:
A customer site is experiencing poor performance. The UI response time is high and searches take a very long time to run. Some operations time out and there are errors in the scheduler logs, indicating too many concurrent searches are being started. 6 total correlation searches are scheduled and they have already been tuned to weed out false positives.
Which of the following options is most likely to help performance?
What should be used to map a non-standard field name to a CIM field name?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer.

Reference from 'Administering Splunk ES' - page 209:
Field aliases to map non-standard field names to CIM field names
A is right
You use a field alias to alias an existing field to a CIM compliant field, thus making the non-compliant field, compliant via proxy.
can anyone explain why is correct answer is A?

questions.question_text: Which of the following lookup types in Enterprise Security contains information about known hostile IP addresses?

discussion.content:
Correct answer is C.
Assets lookup is where you can find IP and mac fields.
Configure > Content Management > Type:Managed lookup > Assets

comments.content: Modifying the answer after some research. Assets lookup is the type where you can add IP addresses for your assets in your environment. Threat Intel is the type where the Known hostile IP addresses is defined. I missed the key word "known hostile ". So Correct answer should be B.

questions.question_text: What role should be assigned to a security team member who will be taking ownership of notable events in the incident review dashboard?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
ess_analyst can own the notable
The ability to change notable event statuses is available to the ess_analyst and ess_admin roles by default.
Should be C. Technically an Admin can be able to do it all, but the responsibility should lie with the ess_analyst. The admin would inherit it as a higher role.

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C
C is correct

C is the correct

ES Analyst
ess_analyst
Owns notable events
and performs notable
event status changes

choices.A: Suppress notable events from that correlation search.
choices.D: Change the correlation search's default status and severity.
choices.C: Modify the correlation schedule and sensitivity for your site.
choices.B: Disable acceleration for the correlation search to reduce storage requirements.

questions.question_text:
A set of correlation searches are enabled at a new ES installation, and results are being monitored. One of the correlation searches is generating many notable events which, when evaluated, are determined to be false positives.
What is a solution for this issue?

discussion.content:
C is correct 
Adjust correlation search sensitivity
– False positives: returning results when none are actually there
– False negatives: returning no results when something is expected

Administering Splunk Enterprise Security page 224

Selected Answer: C
By modifying the correlation search's schedule and sensitivity, you can adjust how frequently the search runs and the criteria it uses to generate notable events. This can help reduce the number of false positives by making the search conditions more stringent or reducing the frequency of the search to better match your environment. Suppression and changing status or severity do not address the root cause of false positives, while modifying the schedule and sensitivity directly impacts the detection criteria.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
C. Modify the correlation schedule and sensitivity
C should be the answer. A is not correct since we cannot suppress a high volume of notable events manually. There will be thousands of them

Selected Answer: A
I also think the answer is A
Think answer should be A.
